channel.title: Curated Email Articles
channel.description: Aggregated articles from email newsletters, filtered and summarized.

item.title: ‎Firefox: Private Web Browser App
item.description:
Summary: This collection of release notes for the Firefox iOS app details updates from version 144.1 to 147.2.1. Key enhancements include on-device translation support for several languages, the integration of Perplexity AI as a search option, UI refinements for better consistency, and various stability and performance improvements.

Tags: Firefox,Mozilla,iOS,Web Browser,Software Update,Release Notes,Perplexity AI,Translation,Privacy


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via The Newest Olympic Sport, Melania's Director, and Undeserving Grammy Winners

item.title: Ethics policy
item.description:
Summary: Platformer's ethics policy and code of conduct detail the publication's standards for journalistic integrity, covering source anonymity, financial independence, and advertising transparency. The document includes specific professional and personal disclosures for founder Casey Newton, outlining his relationships with Vox Media, the New York Times, and a personal connection to Anthropic.

Tags: Journalism Ethics,Platformer,Casey Newton,Media Transparency,Conflict of Interest,Vox Media,The New York Times,Anthropic,Substack,Disclosure Policy


Source: www.platformer.news via Falling in and out of love with Moltbot

item.title: What I learned about productivity this year
item.description:
Summary: The author reflects on their productivity workflow as a journalist and entrepreneur, highlighting software tools that have remained essential over the past year. Key recommendations include Raycast, a Mac launcher with AI capabilities, and Capacities, a personal knowledge management app used for journaling and planning. The article also discusses moving away from certain tools like Readwise and the realization that simple journaling often outweighs complex tagging systems.

Tags: productivity,software,Raycast,Capacities,PKM,Personal Knowledge Management,AI,journalism,Readwise,technology


Source: www.platformer.news via Falling in and out of love with Moltbot

item.title: Recommended stories on the Firefox New Tab page - FAQ
item.description:
Summary: This FAQ article details the 'Recommended stories' feature on the Firefox New Tab page, including information on the shutdown of Pocket services as of July 2025. It explains how Mozilla uses machine learning to curate trustworthy content while protecting user privacy through local personalization, and provides instructions for users to disable or customize recommendations across Desktop, Android, and iOS platforms.

Tags: Firefox,Mozilla,Pocket,Privacy,Web Browsers,Content Curation,FAQ


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via The Newest Olympic Sport, Melania's Director, and Undeserving Grammy Winners

item.title: Firefox Privacy Notice
item.description:
Summary: This Firefox Privacy Notice explains how Mozilla collects and processes data to provide browser functionality, including local processing for AI-driven features like translation and image alt-text. It details how personal data stays on-device by default, the mechanics of search suggestions using privacy-preserving technology like OHTTP, and the controls available to users to manage their data settings.

Tags: Firefox,Mozilla,Privacy,Data Protection,Artificial Intelligence


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via Action Required: Confirm Your Subscription

item.title: Claude Code for writers
item.description:
Summary: The author explores the utility of Claude Code for non-programmers, reflecting on Andrej Karpathy's prediction that English is the hottest new programming language. By utilizing natural language instructions, the writer successfully built a personal website and several custom research tools, illustrating a shift in LLM usage from simple text generation to functional tool creation.

Tags: Claude Code,Anthropic,Andrej Karpathy,Artificial Intelligence,LLM,Software Development,Vibe Coding,Programming,Claude Opus 4.5,Productivity Tools


Source: www.platformer.news via Falling in and out of love with Moltbot

item.title: The 2026 Olympics are the most widespread in history. See what's happening where
item.description:
Summary: The 2026 Winter Olympics, hosted by Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, will be the most geographically widespread in history, spanning 25 venues across 8,495 square miles of northern Italy. To minimize environmental impact, the Games will primarily utilize existing venues across four main clusters: Milan, Cortina, Valtellina, and Val di Fiemme. While this decentralized approach promotes sustainability, officials warn spectators and participants to prepare for significant travel times between the various competition sites.

Tags: 2026 Winter Olympics,Milan-Cortina 2026,Italy,International Olympic Committee,Sarah Hirshland,Winter Sports,Olympic Venues,Sustainability


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via Michael J. Fox, the Winter Olympics, and Frolicking Pandas

item.title: Moltbot (Formerly Clawdbot) Showed Me What the Future of Personal AI Assistants Looks Like
item.description:
Summary: The article explores Moltbot (formerly Clawdbot), an open-source personal AI assistant project created by Peter Steinberger. It functions as a locally-hosted agent that runs on a user's computer, interacts via messaging apps like Telegram, and integrates with numerous services including Spotify, Gmail, and Notion. Highlighting a shift toward sovereign AI, the author details how Moltbot can self-improve by writing and executing scripts, managing local files, and utilizing MCP servers to gain new capabilities.

Tags: Moltbot,Clawdbot,AI,Personal Assistants,Anthropic,Claude Opus,Peter Steinberger,Open Source,Automation,Local AI,ElevenLabs,Telegram


Source: www.platformer.news via Falling in and out of love with Moltbot

item.title: 8 Things You Should Always Grab At The Thrift Store—If You’re Lucky Enough To Find Them
item.description:
Summary: Experts in secondhand shopping provide a guide on eight valuable categories of items to look for at thrift stores, including silver, high-quality chairs, original artwork, and vintage books. The article offers tips on identifying authentic materials like marble and brass, as well as recognizing prestigious china brands and first-edition books.

Tags: Thrifting,Interior Design,Antiques,Secondhand Shopping,Home Decor,Ellie Christopher,Stephanie Wells,Hailey Covington,Emi Deilus,Collectibles,Vintage Furniture,Fine Art


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via Michael J. Fox, the Winter Olympics, and Frolicking Pandas

item.title: Is It Dangerous to Let Kids Be Free?
item.description:
Summary: Adrian Crook, a Vancouver father, faced an investigation by British Columbia's Ministry of Children and Family Development after allowing his four children, aged six to ten, to commute to school independently via public transit. The case highlights the conflict between 'free-range parenting' philosophies—which emphasize child empowerment and statistical safety—and government regulations that mandate adult supervision for children under the age of ten.

Tags: Adrian Crook,Vancouver,parenting,free-range parenting,public transit,child safety,BC Ministry of Children and Family Development,British Columbia,urban planning


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via Michael J. Fox, the Winter Olympics, and Frolicking Pandas

item.title: How to find your InnSæi and reconnect with your intuition
item.description:
Summary: The article explores the Icelandic concept of 'InnSæi', which describes intuition through three lenses: the 'sea within' (unconscious flow), 'seeing within' (self-awareness), and 'seeing from the inside out' (inner compass). The author shares their personal journey of overcoming burnout and personal crisis while working at the United Nations, illustrating how reconnecting with these internal rhythms facilitates healing and clarity.

Tags: InnSæi,intuition,Icelandic culture,self-awareness,mental health,burnout,personal development,United Nations,metacognition


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via The Newest Olympic Sport, Melania's Director, and Undeserving Grammy Winners

item.title: At the Rubber Tramp Rendezvous, nomads find community in the Arizona desert
item.description:
Summary: The Rubber Tramp Rendezvous (RTR) in Quartzsite, Arizona, is an annual gathering for vehicle-dwelling nomads organized by the nonprofit Homes on Wheels Alliance. The event fosters a supportive community for people living in vans, cars, and RVs, offering mutual aid, skill-sharing, and resources for those embracing a minimalist lifestyle or seeking shelter from homelessness. Founded by Bob Wells and Suanne Carlson, the gathering serves as a vital safety net and educational hub for the growing mobile lifestyle movement.

Tags: Rubber Tramp Rendezvous,Quartzsite,Arizona,Homes on Wheels Alliance,Nomadism,Van Life,Bob Wells,Suanne Carlson,Community Support,Mutual Aid,Minimalism


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via The Newest Olympic Sport, Melania's Director, and Undeserving Grammy Winners

item.description:
Summary: A collection of news blurbs covering diverse topics including Donald Trump's political strategies, Prince Andrew's relocation, Whoopi Goldberg's venture into Italian television, and the move of the Sundance Film Festival to Colorado, alongside updates from Paris Fashion Week and the tech industry.

item.title: The 10 Most Undeserving Album of the Year Winners in Grammy History
item.description:
Summary: An editorial critique of historical Grammy Award 'Album of the Year' winners considered undeserving when compared to their fellow nominees. The article explores the Recording Academy's tendency toward safe choices and 'lifetime achievement' style wins, specifically highlighting instances like Frank Sinatra's 'A Man and His Music' beating The Beatles' 'Revolver' and Steely Dan's 'Two Against Nature' winning over Radiohead and Eminem.

Tags: Grammy Awards,Recording Academy,Album of the Year,Music History,Frank Sinatra,The Beatles,Steely Dan,Radiohead,Eminem,Beck


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via The Newest Olympic Sport, Melania's Director, and Undeserving Grammy Winners

item.description:

item.title: A Creature of the Sea Found the Secret to Immortality—and Humans Might Be Able to Steal It
item.description:
Summary: Researchers at the University of Vienna have identified potential multipotent stem cells in the scarlet sea anemone (Nematostella vectensis), a creature known for its remarkable regenerative abilities and lack of biological aging. Using single-cell genomics and CRISPR technology, the team localized cells regulated by highly-conserved genes like nanos and piwi, which drive the animal's capacity to replace nerve and glandular cells. This discovery offers new insights into the evolutionary origins of stem cells and provides a model for future anti-aging and regenerative medicine research.

Tags: Nematostella vectensis,Sea Anemone,Regeneration,Stem Cells,Anti-aging,University of Vienna,Single-cell Genomics,CRISPR,Biology,Cnidaria,Ulrich Technau,Science Advances


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via Michael J. Fox, the Winter Olympics, and Frolicking Pandas

item.title: It’s one storm after another for much of the US, but the next one’s path is uncertain
item.description:
Summary: A major winter storm, potentially developing into a powerful 'bomb cyclone,' is forecast to strike the U.S. East Coast, bringing heavy snow and subfreezing temperatures. While significant snowfall is expected in the Carolinas and Virginia, meteorologists are still monitoring whether the storm will track along the I-95 corridor to impact cities like Washington and Boston or veer out to sea.

Tags: Winter Storm,Bomb Cyclone,Weather Forecast,NOAA,The Weather Channel,AccuWeather,Climate Change,Peter Mullinax,James Belanger,Ryan Maue,Dan Pydynowski,Bernadette Woods Placky


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via Michael J. Fox, the Winter Olympics, and Frolicking Pandas

item.title: Inside the White House in the chaotic hours after Alex Pretti's shooting
item.description:
Summary: Following the shooting of American citizen Alex Pretti by Border Patrol agents in Minneapolis, President Trump has shifted his administration's strategy to improve the optics of his mass-deportation operations. While maintaining his underlying policy goals, Trump replaced field commander Greg Bovino with Tom Homan and sidelined DHS Secretary Kristi Noem in an attempt to de-escalate tensions. These moves have sparked internal finger-pointing and a backlash from his MAGA base, who view the shift as a sign of weakness ahead of the midterm elections.

Tags: Donald Trump,Alex Pretti,White House,Immigration,Mass Deportation,Minneapolis,Tom Homan,Greg Bovino,Kristi Noem,Tim Walz,Jacob Frey,Department of Homeland Security,Border Patrol,Midterm Elections,NBC News


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via Michael J. Fox, the Winter Olympics, and Frolicking Pandas

item.title: 5 Best Restaurants in the U.S., According to Guy Fieri
item.description:
Summary: Guy Fieri, the host of 'Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives,' identifies his top five favorite restaurants across the United States. His selection highlights authentic, high-quality eateries including La Scarola in Chicago, Olneyville N.Y. System in Providence, Roberto's Taco Shop in Las Vegas, Tom's Barbecue in Memphis, and Kuma's Corner in Chicago, all celebrated for their bold flavors and soul.

Tags: Guy Fieri,Restaurants,Food Network,Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives,La Scarola,Olneyville N.Y. System,Roberto's Taco Shop,Tom's Barbecue,Kuma's Corner,Chicago,Providence,Las Vegas,Memphis,American Cuisine


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via Michael J. Fox, the Winter Olympics, and Frolicking Pandas

item.title: Trump facing growing cultural revolt against immigration crackdown
item.description:
Summary: President Donald Trump is facing a significant cultural and corporate backlash against his administration's aggressive immigration policies. High-profile figures including Tim Cook, Bruce Springsteen, Sam Altman, and Martha Stewart have publicly condemned the tactics used by federal agents, particularly following fatal incidents in Minnesota. This widespread 'revolt' from the worlds of business and entertainment is creating concern among Republican strategists regarding the party's strength ahead of the midterm elections.

Tags: Donald Trump,immigration,ICE,Minnesota,Apple,Tim Cook,OpenAI,Sam Altman,Bruce Springsteen,Martha Stewart,Joe Rogan,Republican Party,midterm elections,Tom Homan


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via The Newest Olympic Sport, Melania's Director, and Undeserving Grammy Winners

item.title: The only person to win an Olympic medal and a Nobel Peace Prize
item.description:
Summary: Philip Noel-Baker holds the unique distinction of being the only person to win both an Olympic medal and a Nobel Peace Prize. An accomplished runner, he won a silver medal in the 1500-meter race at the 1920 Antwerp Olympics. Beyond his athletic career, Noel-Baker was a dedicated pacifist and diplomat who played instrumental roles in the League of Nations and the United Nations, eventually earning the Nobel Peace Prize in 1959 for his lifelong commitment to multilateral disarmament.

Tags: Philip Noel-Baker,Olympics,Nobel Peace Prize,Disarmament,History,United Nations,League of Nations,Biography,Pacifism


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via The Newest Olympic Sport, Melania's Director, and Undeserving Grammy Winners

item.title: This is officially the world’s most beautiful concert venue, according to Time Out
item.description:
Summary: Time Out has named Colorado's Red Rocks Amphitheatre as the world's most beautiful concert venue. The rankings highlight various iconic global locations, including the Sydney Opera House and Vienna's Musikverein, focusing on unique architecture and natural settings that enhance the live music experience.

Tags: Time Out,Music,Concert Venues,Red Rocks Amphitheatre,Travel,Architecture,Entertainment,Sydney Opera House,Musikverein


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via The Newest Olympic Sport, Melania's Director, and Undeserving Grammy Winners

item.title: What to eat when nothing sounds good
item.description:
Summary: This article explores how to navigate the 'appetite gap'—those moments when you are hungry but uninspired by food due to stress, burnout, or mild illness. The author suggests a philosophy of selecting food based on sensory categories like temperature, texture, and effort level rather than specific recipes, offering examples such as cold-brewed green tea and simple rice-and-egg bowls.

Tags: Food,Wellness,Nutrition,Cooking,Mental Health,Lifestyle,Appetite


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via The Newest Olympic Sport, Melania's Director, and Undeserving Grammy Winners

item.title: Why disgraced Rush Hour director Brett Ratner was the only man for the Melania documentary
item.description:
Summary: After years of Hollywood exile following multiple sexual misconduct allegations in 2017, director Brett Ratner is making a career comeback through his close ties with Donald Trump. His return includes a feature-length documentary about Melania Trump and a planned production of Rush Hour 4, highlighting how personal connections to the Trump family have facilitated his re-entry into the industry.

Tags: Brett Ratner,Melania Trump,Donald Trump,Hollywood,MeToo,Rush Hour,Documentary,Sexual Misconduct Allegations,Mar-a-Lago,Entertainment News


Source: clicks.mozilla.org via The Newest Olympic Sport, Melania's Director, and Undeserving Grammy Winners

item.title: Falling in and out of love with Moltbot
item.description:
Summary: Tech journalist Casey Newton explores Moltbot (formerly Clawdbot), an open-source, locally running AI assistant inspired by Federico Viticci's workflows. The article details Moltbot's unique features—such as messaging app integration and persistent memory—while questioning how powerful personal AI agents might eventually replace traditional standalone utility apps and manual automations.

Tags: AI,Moltbot,Clawdbot,Anthropic,Claude Code,Automation,Software Review,Federico Viticci,Peter Steinberger,Productivity Tools


Source: www.platformer.news via Falling in and out of love with Moltbot
